channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Suze Orman says retirees should have a 5-year ‘just-in-case’ fund. Is she right?
item.description: “I had people coming unglued on me when I suggested retirees should have three to five years of their savings in a money-market fund or CDs.”

item.title: Jensen Huang says Nvidia is missing out on a Boeing-sized opportunity in China: ‘Not a plane, the entire company.’
item.description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang made a not-very-subtle case for the Trump administration to review their China microchip restrictions.

item.title: My second wife says her 2 kids should inherit our estate, but I also have 2 kids. Is that fair?
item.description: “I will leave the $1 million inheritance I received from my parents to my biological daughters.”

item.title: Novo Nordisk shares are rising after the company cut its outlook. It’s been that kind of year.
item.description: Novo Nordisk is managing the unusual feat of seeing its stock price rise after reducing its earnings outlook.

item.title: Wednesday’s big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
item.description: Stocks posted back-to-back declines on Tuesday, with the Dow Industrials sliding nearly 400 points. Here's what's on CNBC's radar heading into Wednesd...

item.title: This mouse and keyboard maker is a buy thanks to strong Generation Alpha gaming trends, UBS says
item.description: UBS pointed to rising gamification in Generation Alpha as a main catalyst driving Logitech going forward.

item.title: The economy is showing signs of weakening. Here’s what it means for investors hunting yield
item.description: Quality in the world of fixed income is back in focus as the U.S. economy begins to show some cracks.

item.title: Small investors rushed into Berkshire shares during dip even after their hero Buffett set exit
item.description: Everyday traders bought more than $24 million of Class B shares on Monday.
